intro: Amaioua magnicarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited amaioua, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that are typically orange to red in color, containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
